availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Judith Hammond Gray in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 8, 1831. Father of Nancy Gray, Sallie Gray, John E. Gray, Lorinda Gray, Lucinda Gray, Lenora Gray, Judith Margaret Gray, and Samuel N. Gray. Married to Eliza Eaton Gray in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 15, 1851. Father of William Gray, James Newton Gray, and Ava M. Gray. Farmer in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved person in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Served in the Kentucky State Militia as adjutant in Woodford County in 1861.
